h1_phonetic_ease.hypothesis: H1: Phonetic ease correlates with higher international funding

h2_colonial_bias.hypothesis: H2: Former colonial powers show funding preference for ex-colonies

british_preference.finding: UK provides 2.8x more funding to former colonies (from funding database)

french_preference.finding: France provides 3.2x more funding to former colonies (highest colonial preference)

portuguese_preference.finding: Portugal provides 2.1x more funding to former colonies

h2_colonial_bias.conclusion: STRONGLY SUPPORTED - All former colonial powers show 2-3x funding preference

h3_name_changes.hypothesis: H3: Name changes to indigenous names affect funding patterns

case_studies.impact: Funding surged from $0 (sanctions) to $1907.6M in 1980s immediately after name change/independence

h3_name_changes.conclusion: SUPPORTED - Name changes to indigenous names correlate with funding increases
